intro: Premna somaliensis, commonly known as Somali glorybower, is a shrub or small tree native to the Horn of Africa. It belongs to the family Verbenaceae and is characterized by its opposite, ovate leaves with a smooth or slightly hairy surface. The plant produces clusters of small, white or pale yellow flowers that bloom in the summer months. Its fruits are small capsules that split open to release tiny seeds. Premna somaliensis is often found in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to arid environments.
